text: Most would say that parting children from their mother is a cruel act. Not so much with Skattach and her Fimir though.
This Fimir likes to play an instrument known to the mist-daemons as "Bogpipe", melodious to the Fimir, but horrendously cacophonic to other races.
This Fimir practises Brollaidheacht, a form of wrestling popular with all castes where two Fimir will try to push one another outside of a sacred circle. The first to go out of the circle loses.
This Fimir has taken the Daemon Prince Lisaart the Serpent, Master of Camouflage and cunning trickster as their chosen patron deity.
This Fimir has taken the Daemon Prince Balor, Master of Battle and warrior of great prowess, as their chosen patron deity.
This Fimir has taken the Daemon Prince Kroll, Mistress of Plenty and guardian of the bogs, as their chosen patron deity.
This character is known as a "Flaithmor", a Fimm renowned for his skill in duelling and killing enemy champions. They command huge respect amongst the rest of the Fimm Caste.
This Fimm delights in enslaving other beings, be them Fimir or non-Fimir, cruelly pushing them to work and fight harder.

This Dirach is a masterful player of Fidchell, a board game popular amongst the Dirach with a multitude of different pieces and rules that are seemingly tedious and unintuitive to an outside observer, but requires keen intellect and quick cunning to win.
All Dirach have a natural talent for magic, but this one has such raw potential that he is able to act as focus of the Winds to the other Dirach.

This Fimir is known for having a knack in telling the many stories, legends and songs of their race to inspire fellow Fimir. From the tale of the great war against the Human tribe of the Jutones to grandiose tales about the lost Fimir homeland of the Wandering Isle.
